part1.converted_description:
You are given a 50x50 grid representing a lumber collection area. Each acre can be either open ground (.), trees (|), or a lumberyard (#). The landscape changes every minute based on the contents of each acre and the number of adjacent acres that are open, wooded, or lumberyards. An open acre becomes filled with trees if three or more adjacent acres contain trees. A wooded acre becomes a lumberyard if three or more adjacent acres are lumberyards. A lumberyard remains a lumberyard if it is adjacent to at least one other lumberyard and at least one acre containing trees; otherwise, it becomes open. The changes happen simultaneously. After 10 minutes, calculate the total resource value of the lumber collection area, which is the number of wooded acres multiplied by the number of lumberyards.

Input Format:
The input is a 50x50 grid of characters representing the initial state of the lumber collection area.

part2.converted_description:
Given the same initial state, calculate the total resource value of the lumber collection area after 1,000,000,000 minutes.

Input Format:
The input is a 50x50 grid of characters representing the initial state of the lumber collection area.
